title: Question About Janna PBE Q Change
body:
Janna's Q currently has some tentative changes on the PBE.  These changes indicate that for each second it charges, it now travels 35% further rather than 20% further.  It seems strange to me that Janna is getting buffed, and this sounds like a buff without any more info.  Is this buff intended to somewhat offset the nerf on the scaling on her R, or is the initial travel range on Q nerfed but this simply isn't indicated on the tooltip?  My assumption is kind of that the total travel range at full charge is the same, but Q travels less far if it isn't fully charged, but I haven't seen any discussion about this.

Thanks for any info!

replies.body: Yeah, your guess is right. Janna's initial Q cast range is nerfed on the PBE, but the gain over time's increased so that the range at full charge is the same.

I don't get why Fiora gets a significantly better heal than Janna, a support champ. It doesn't even need to be channelled unlike Monsoon.

I also don't know anyone who charges their tornado. It's a reactive spell :/

I really think Janna's ult should leave behind the healing area and the healing is decreased for first seconds of the ult then increasing dramatically at the later end of the healing. I think this would encourage active teamfighting than the boring "cock-block" gameplay prevalent fighting against Janna.

The Q changes feel awful as a Janna player. :/ I've spent a long time trying to master how long to charge or not charge my Q to hit a target, and this completely fucks with that. You've already made it shitty to throw a fast Q by completely gutting its non charged damage at the start of last season. 

Why is she even being nerfed? She's one of the only champions that can deal with Thresh and Alistar's domination of bot lane. Meanwhile Thresh has been picked 40%+ every game as a support since his release and you recently _buffed _him. Like wtf?

The nerfs to her AP ratio doesn't make any sense either, since most Janna's don't even build AP. Why are you punishing AP Janna when it's not popular at all right now, and actually fairly weak? 

With the insane number of nerfs Janna has had (she's been nerfed more than any other champion) I'm fairly convinced the balance team has no idea how to balance her correctly.

In all honesty, this is a nerf that I couldn't care less about. I have always used Janna's Q for disengage and that usually involves the enemy being fairly close anyway. Maybe I am not using the ability to its full potential but if you guys removed the charge factor entirely from the ability I would probably consider it a buff since I wouldn't need to keep double tapping Q. Same with Monsoon, if you removed the heal entirely I probably wouldn't care.

The fact that these nerfs don't really matter is precisely why you shouldn't do them too. Janna will still be played as she always has (which I assume is a problem hence the nerfs) and all this will do is antagonize Janna mains such as myself and make them especially bitter when, a patch or two later, you finally get around to nerfing something that is actually important to her playstyle.
